Once you achieve an understanding of algebra, the higher-level math subjects become accessible to you. Without it, it's impossible to move forward. It's used by people with lots of different jobs, like carpentry, engineering, and fashion design. In these tutorials, we'll cover a lot of ground. snippet.title: Mistakes when finding inflection points: second derivative undefined | AP Calculus AB | Khan Academy

snippet.description:
Inflection points are points where the function changes concavity, i.e. from being "concave up" to being "concave down" or vice versa. They can be found by considering where the second derivative changes signs. In similar to critical points in the first derivative, inflection points will occur when the second derivative is either zero or undefined. Created by Sal Khan.

Practice this lesson yourself on KhanAcademy.org right now: https://www.khanacademy.org/math/ap-calculus-ab/ab-derivatives-analyze-functions/ab-concavity/e/analyze-points-of-inflection-graphical?utm_source=YT&utm_medium=Desc&utm_campaign=APCalculusAB 

Watch the next lesson: https://www.khanacademy.org/math/ap-calculus-ab/ab-derivatives-analyze-functions/ab-concavity/v/inflection-points-graphically-given-function?utm_source=YT&utm_medium=Desc&utm_campaign=APCalculusAB
